🏢ABOUT WEATHERHAVEN

GLOBAL LEADER IN
DEPLOYABLE SHELTERS

For over four decades, Weatherhaven has been pioneering deployable shelter technology, providing rapid-deployment solutions that perform reliably in the world's most challenging environments.

40+
Years Experience
50+
Countries Served
1000+
Deployments
24/7
Global Support

OUR HISTORY

Four decades of innovation, growth, and commitment to excellence in deployable shelter technology.

1983

Company Founded

Weatherhaven established in Vancouver, Canada, pioneering deployable shelter technology.

1990

First Military Contract

Secured major military contract for tactical command centers, establishing defense market presence.

1995

International Expansion

Opened European operations and began serving clients in over 20 countries worldwide.

2000

Disaster Response Division

Launched specialized division for emergency response and humanitarian aid shelters.

2008

Arctic Research Success

Deployed custom research facilities in extreme Arctic conditions, expanding into scientific applications.

2015

Global Manufacturing

Established manufacturing facilities in North America, Europe, and Asia for global reach.

2020

Digital Innovation

Launched digital configurator platform and advanced IoT integration for smart shelters.

2024

Future Forward

Leading the industry with sustainable materials and next-generation deployable solutions.

OUR TEAM

Our team has over 1000 years of experience designing, planning, and implementing shelter and camp solutions in every corner of the globe. Any climate. Any terrain. Any logistical challenge.

EXECUTIVE LEADERSHIP

Ray Castelli, B. Comm

Chief Executive Officer

Ray joined Weatherhaven as CEO in 2008 after a 20 year international business career in technology, natural resources and government/defence. He has significant international procurement expertise.

BACKGROUND

Former co-founder and SVP of Dallas-based Quadrem (now SAP), Chair of Open Network for Commerce Exchange (ONCE), Chief of Staff to Minister of National Defence

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
Led Weatherhaven since 2008
Established global procurement standards
Speaks 5 languages
Alumnus of SFU Business School and INSEAD
EXPERTISE
Strategic LeadershipInternational BusinessGovernment RelationsTechnology

James Kirk, M. Eng, C. Eng

Chief Operating Officer

A graduate of the UK Ministry of Defence, Engineering and Science Group, James earned a Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Sheffield.

BACKGROUND

10 years within MOD leading strategic UK Defence procurement programmes, Technical Director at Weatherhaven since 2008

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
Managing Director UK 2014-2019
Vice President of Global Sales 2019-2021
COO since 2021
Sustained growth in European military market
EXPERTISE
Operations ManagementDefense ProcurementEngineering LeadershipEuropean Markets

Alberto Moreno, B. Eng.

Chief Business Development Officer

A graduate of the engineering program at UDLAP in Mexico in 1992, Alberto brings extensive experience in program management and operations.

BACKGROUND

Former program manager at Oceanworks, led Weatherhaven PMO 2012-2015, Chief Operations Officer 2015-2020

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
Led newly formed Project Management Office (PMO)
Oversaw all production operations, supply chain, quality, engineering
Appointed CBDO in November 2020
EXPERTISE
Business DevelopmentProgram ManagementOperationsSupply Chain

Jessica Au, CPA, CA

Chief Financial Officer

Jessica was appointed Chief Financial Officer of Weatherhaven in 2025, following her progression from Vice President of Finance, a role she assumed in 2022.

BACKGROUND

Joined as Controller in 2018, VP Finance 2022-2025, Senior finance positions across utilities, energy, technology, manufacturing, and defense sectors

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA, CA)
Bachelor of Commerce from UBC
More than a decade of management and leadership experience
Former PwC professional
EXPERTISE
Financial StrategyCorporate GovernanceOperational ExcellenceMultinational Operations

REGIONAL MANAGING DIRECTORS

Natalia Mederios, B. Eng, MBA

Managing Director, Weatherhaven Brazil

Natalia graduated from Universidad Federal de Minas Gerais, with a degree in Electrical Engineering, and a post graduate major in renewable energy.

MBA IBMEC in Rio de Janeiro, former Marketing and Sales Director at ESTRE Waste Management, Vice President of Environmental Solutions Brazil
Leading Weatherhaven operations in Brazil since 2014

Dr. Susannah Kirk, B.Eng PhD C. Eng MRAeS

Managing Director, Weatherhaven Global Solutions (UK)

Susannah has a degree in Aeronautical Engineering from Loughborough University and a PhD in Static Aeroelasticity from University of Bristol.

Chartered Engineer and Member of the Royal Aeronautical Society, 10 years experience in aerospace engineering
Head of Engineering in UK, specializing in CAD and camp design visualizations

Hugo Cueva, B. Eng.

Managing Director, Weatherhaven Peru

A Civil Engineer with more than 15 years of experience in projects management and control, Hugo graduated from the National University of Engineering of Peru.

Strong knowledge in project management based on PMI standards, joined Weatherhaven Peru as Logistics Coordinator in 2010
General Manager of Peruvian branch since 2015, developed many processes achieving time and cost reduction

Scott Jackson

VP Business Development - USA

A skilled team leader and authority in expeditionary solutions, Scott leads Weatherhaven's business development efforts in the US shelter solutions market.

Retired Air Force SMSgt with 20 years of honorable active-duty service, Regional Manager at DHS Systems (DRASH), AAR Mobility
Member of Weatherhaven's Senior Management Team, introducing "Next Generation Shelter Solutions" to the US Market

REGIONAL SALES LEADS

Karla Arias

Business Development Director - Latin America

As the current Business Development Director for Latin America, Karla works with clients in the Latin American military and medical markets.

Diploma in Hotel and Resort Management in 1993, started at Weatherhaven in 1993

Mike Ball

Global Commercial Sales Lead

Mike has over 27 years of experience in the relocatable shelter and remote site based industry, primarily focusing on the mining and gas industry.

Graduate of Economics from the University of British Columbia, post graduate study in sales and marketing, extensive international experience

Sweena Chatha

Senior Director of Sales and Marketing - Canada Defence

Sweena focuses on the Canadian military and medical shelters, and works with clients to provide expertise on various options for remote-site shelters.

Bachelor of Journalism at Carleton University, Certificate of Media Techniques and Marketing Communications at BCIT, started at Weatherhaven in 2001

George Banks-Martin

Sales Lead - UK and Europe

George has worked at Weatherhaven Global Solutions since 2008 in a variety of roles from technical writing to training and joined the sales team in 2016.

Studied history at Oxford University and African politics at SOAS, London University, previous career as a classical concert and opera singer
